item.title: Engineering Projects
item.description: Projects on this page illustrate reactive and proactive problem solving projects I worked on either directly as a team leader or as an advisor to the primary project team. The projects show how Shainin Red X and Green Y methods can quickly converge on the root cause of a technical problem. Reactive Problem Solving Reactive problem solving occurs when a problem already exists and needs attention, whether it be for a line-down situation or to eliminate chronic problems.

item.title: Programming Projects
item.description: All of my personal projects can be found on GitHub. Below are some projects that I am particularly proud of: ProjectEuler Project Euler is a collection of challenging math problems solved with programming. I have used these problems for intellectual stimulation and to practice coding in Java. Problem descriptions are here. My repository is here and below are a few I am proud of: Problem #12: Find the first triangular number that has at least 500 divisors (has some cool optimizations) Problem #13: Find the first 10 digits of the sum of 100 fifty-digit numbers Problem #15: Find the number of paths through a 20 x 20 grid (this one was HARD…there’s probably an easier way) Problem #16: Find the sum of the digits in 2^1000 (Wish I knew about BigDecimal before this one!
